thread.title: Tattoo Collective: UK’s best tat artists show off their stunning creations
thread.title_full: Tattoo Collective: UK’s best tat artists show off their stunning creations

title: Tattoo Collective: UK’s best tat artists show off their stunning creations
text:
Tattoo Collective: UK’s best tat artists show off their stunning creations Tattoo Collective: UK’s best tat artists show off their stunning creations THE very best tattooists came together in a new event celebrating the most striking ink around. / Published 22nd February 2017 
Tattoo Life magazine selected the sharpest talent to take part in the Tattoo Collective in east London. 
And the Daily Star was there to capture the most beautiful and innovative work being done. 
Here we meet some of the inkredible artists and their human canvasses. 
GERARD FARRELL/DZ PICTURES BODY ART: Tattoo Collective showcased some of the best artists from the UK 
Fashion writer Charlotte Muscat, 27, is well on her way to her dream of having her whole body covered. She has been visiting John Fowler’s East Side Tattoo Studio in Bethnal Green, east London, for a year. 
Every month she spends a full day being worked on, at £450 a session. “I want to get the full body suit,” she says. 
“I send ideas to John for what I want, but you can’t really tell what it’s going to look like until you have it done and see it come together. 
“I think another year of work on it will give me good coverage and then I’d like to add in more detail and layers, and have some white on top so it doesn’t look flat. International London Tattoo Convention 2016 Saturday, 24th September 2016 The International London Tattoo Convention runs from 23 to 25 September and brings together tattoo artists from the US, Australia, Canada, Japan and UK to London. 1 / 13 A tattoo enthusiast poses at the International London Tattoo Convention in London 
GERARRD FARRELL/DZ PICTURES TALENT: Craig Kelly is an Irish artist from Belfast 
“I’ve spent so much time with John, he’s a friend to me now. Luckily my job as a fashion writer means I can do this – I’m not sure I could get away with it working in an office!” 
Tattooist Pedro Mendonca is etching the phrase Self Made Established 1999 on the back of one man’s head. 
Craig Kelly is one of just three Irish artists at the convention and has jetted in from Belfast for the weekend. 
Fellow Belfast boy Aaron McCloskey, 19, has flown over to get further work on his leopard design done by Craig. 
GERARD FARRELL/DZ PICTURES DREAM: Charlotte Muscat's goal is to have her entire body covered one day 
He says: “It’s worth the price of the flight to be here. We started the piece in Belfast and booking in here saved waiting over there.” “I’ve never had a negative reaction to my face tattoos – people are always interested and want to ask me about them” Monami Frost 
Bruno Santos and Isnard Barbosa are collaborating to give Emily Fleming, 23, from Dublin, her dream Native American design. 
Bruno says: “We will spend seven hours on this today – it’s just whether Emily can stand the pain for that long. But she’s doing really well so far.” 
Emily adds: “I’ve been looking forward to getting this done for so long – I’m so happy it’s actually happening today.” 
Tattooist Ryan ‘The Scientist’ Smith is etching a beautiful face design on the thigh of one woman. 
GERARD FARRELL/DZ PICTURES TAT: Emily Fleming is having a Native American design done 
Explaining his nickname, he says: “I used to be a music producer and I have a First Class Honours degree in sound engineering. 
“So it refers to my approach to my work but also my background – I was the scientist of sound!” 
London-girl Laura Snowling, 33, is having a griffin on her arm courtesy of Aimee Cornwell while Brighton lass Georgina Langford-Biss, 30, is having a huge chrysanthemum design on her back. 
Among the other tattoo artists is Arron Raw, who has a detailed face inking on the side of his head. 
GERARD FARREL/DZ PICTURES PAINFUL: The five-eyed tiger on Kris' head hurt the most 
Rachel Peppiatt is working with her husband Jack and the pair have travelled to London from Edinburgh. 
She says: “Jack did most of the tattoos on my arm – I don’t get a discount though, can you believe it?” 
Kris Wright, 32, from Romford, Essex, has been having tattoos for the past 16 years and admits he’s lost count of how many he has. 
“The most painful was the fi ve-eyed lion on the top of my head,” he says. 
GERARD FARRELL/DZ PICTURES DUO: Rachel Peppiat travelled to London with her husband, from Edinburgh 
“I normally let the tattoo artist do whatever they want – I think you get the best out of them if they feel comfortable with what they are doing. 
“I’ve never been unhappy with the result – I go to artists whose work I like, so it’s never a disappointment.” 
Monami Frost, 23, who is originally from Latvia but now lives in Liverpool, has several striking tattoos on her face, including the word Devotion and a snowfl ake in white ink. 
She says: “I’ve never had a negative reaction to my face tattoos – people are always interested and want to ask me about them.” Related articles
